content.description: Great problem for beginners to work finger crack moves. The only down side to this problem is you will wish it went another thousand feet. Here you will sit start on a good finger crack and OK feet, then simply climb the crack until you reach the top. The top out is mossy here as well.
content.location: Three feet left of Peapod an obvious short right trending finger crack.

content.description: In my opinion if this problem was taken back by lichen it would be no big loss. You sit start on the front rounded arete on a ledge with good hands and feet and move up to a gaston, or if you can all the way up into the undercling in the right trending overlap, then move feet up to the ledge you started with your hands on, make another move in the small right trending overlap then top out. The topout is mossy.
content.protection: Pad and a spotter for hole to the right.
content.location: Northwest of the Spraguesorus boulder and northeast of Zig-Zag Boulder

content.description:
This route is fun consisting of moves linking jugs. Sit Start on the arete with jugs then move straight up to the only non jug on the route. Then break left heading towards and obvious jug then top out.  

  The name refers to the dead tree we removed using a sharp rock and the fact that we had to pry a 200 pound diamond shaped piece of rock off. This was done after two of us had climbed it. We pulled the rock off then I resent it in its current state.
content.location: Approach the New Age Block the walk left there is a little orange overhang, this route starts on the arete and works left on the orange face.

content.description: Stand start in the hole on the right of Peedunckle. Grab two large opposing sidepulls and climb to the top using the obvious crimps in the face. Make an easy top out on weird jugs.  If this stays clean it will become a staple of the Black Jack warm-up circuit.
content.protection: A few pads and a good spotter. Best not to fall off the top out of this one, but the route is safe to work.
content.location: On the right side of the New Age boulder, Â in a hole/cave. Easily seen from Zig Zag Crack.

content.description: This area contains two boulders, a large one and a slightly smaller one. Theses boulders don't see much traffic, but they house several fun and challenging problems, alongside several good warm-ups for more difficult problems in the area.
